content.question: Which of the following is true if the production of a good creates negative externalities?

choices.label: The market produces the socially efficient level of output.
The market price equals the marginal social cost.
The marginal social cost exceeds the marginal private cost.
The good is produced by the public sector.

content.answer: The marginal social cost exceeds the marginal private cost.
